CatDescriptText: Miss Marie Travillion, 40 Steuben St., Langley High School student, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 3, 1958, pg. 1A with question: "Do you think that the average family spends too much time watching television programs? If so, how has it affected family life?" answer reads: "I think the school kids spend too much time watching television.  Therefore they do not get their homework done.  The parents are not affected too much by television."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Marie Travillion, wearing light colored button down sweater and pleated skirt, holding item in right hand, standing on Liberty Avenue in front of Jenkins Arcade,  with pedestrians, garbage can that reads "Read Pittsburgh Papers", and May Building with sign reading Thrift Drugs in background, Downtown
